text:
Sometimes, i made modifications on the sampler values
(change the file path in a CSV Config, or change the SQL in the JDBC Sampler),
and then i save the test plan.. but the sampler don´t save the changes. 
If i click another element in the tree and then click back the changes did not
appear.

1- New Test Plan
2- add thread group
3- add a csv data set config
4- change the file name, variable names and delimiter
5- save test plan in some directory
6- change the filename
7- click on thread group element
8- click back on the csv data set config
 -> see change didn´t was taken.

this is an example, but is more generic. the problem affect much more objects.

creator: alf@i100.no
text:
Created attachment 20143
Suggested patch

This solves the problem I was able to reproduce, i.e. when changing the
selected node right after the test plan was saved.

It was related to the change in the GUIPackage, in SVN-535134, for bug 30120.
If I put back in
"
if (currentNode != treeListener.getCurrentNode()) {
   currentNodeUpdated = true;
}
", then this bug did not happen.
But I think it is better to change the Save action to call
GuiPackage.getInstance().updateCurrentGui() to set the currentNodeUpdated flag
to false.

If people find other scenarios where test plan changes are not stored, then we
might need to consider reverting the change.
But for now, I do not know of any issues after this suggested patch has been
applied.
